page.title: 11GT.YARMOUTH-NORWICH RAILWAY
page.content: Although the railway system of South-East Norfolk suffered drastic cuts under the 'Beeching Axe' it still provides a useful,if somewhat un- economic service.The line from Great Yarmouth to Norwich via Reedham follows an interesting and scenic route.The single track is safe-guarded by a token which the train driver must collect as his authority for right of way.Passengers pay their single fare of about Â£1.50 on the train.From Yarmouth the line runs along the North shore of Breydon Water and close to the R.Yare to Reedham.Here it joins the Lowestoft-Norwich line.Trains usually consist of two diesel driven carriages.
